meanings.definition: To turn around a central point.
meanings.sent1: The Earth rotates on its axis, causing day and night.
meanings.sent2: The windmill rotates with the breeze to generate electricity.
meanings.sent3: The lazy Susan rotates slowly, making it hard to grab the snacks.
meanings.sent4: Time rotates like a wheel, bringing new opportunities with each turn.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse rotates its beam, guiding ships safely to shore.

meanings.sent1: The students rotate in line to take their turn on the swing.
meanings.sent2: The players rotate positions on the field during the game.
meanings.sent3: The siblings rotate chores every week to keep things fair.
meanings.sent4: The seasons rotate throughout the year, each bringing its own beauty.
meanings.sent5: The workers rotate shifts to ensure everyone gets a chance for breaks.

meanings.definition: To change or alternate in a regular order.
meanings.sent1: The colors on the carousel rotate as it spins around.
meanings.sent2: The menu at the restaurant rotates daily to offer variety.
meanings.sent3: The tires on the car rotate to ensure even wear and tear.
meanings.sent4: The planets rotate in their orbits, following a cosmic dance.
meanings.sent5: The flavors of ice cream rotate weekly, keeping customers excited.
